sen.j: 寿福院（じゅふくいん、元亀元年（1570年） - 寛永8年3月6日 (旧暦)（1631年4月7日））は、加賀藩主前田氏の祖・前田利家の側室。
sen.e: Jufukuin (1570-April 7, 1631) was the concubine of Toshiie Maeda, who was the founder of the Maeda clan, the ruling family of the Kaga domain.

sen.j: 朝倉氏家臣・上木新兵衛の三女。

sen.e: She started serving the Maeda clan as a maid for O-Matsu-no-kata (aka, ' Hoshuin'), the legal wife of Toshiie.

sen.e: She was flirted with by Toshiie and became his concubine when he stayed at a camp in Nagoya Castel during the Bunroku-Keicho War, and later she gave birth to Toshitsune MAEDA, the third head of the Maeda clan.

sen.e: After the death of Toshinaga MAEDA, the second head of the clan, Jufukuin's son Toshitsune became the head of the clan, and she was dispatched to Edo as a hostage in exchange for Hoshuin.

sen.j: 寿福院は熱心な日蓮宗徒であり、江戸に人質に出されていた元和 (日本)8年（1622年）、安房国の誕生寺 (鴨川市)に法華経を奉納している。
sen.e: Jufukuin was an ardent follower of the Nichiren Sect and presented the Lotus Sutra to Tanjo-ji Temple (Kamogawa City) as a tribute in 1622 when she was dispatched to Edo as a hostage.
